title: Spare hours...
author: Brown, John
snippet: and his beard black as an Arab sheik's, as he strode along Princes Street in his decorous kilt of hodden gray, — for he detested the Cockney fopperies and curt garments of what he called " Sabbath-day Hielandmen," — as if he were on the heather in his own " Black Wood." His last act before leaving this country for the South, to die, was to give his thin, trembling hand to lower his Duke and friend into the grave at Blair ; and as he came home he said, " I '11 be the next " ; and so he was.
